website_summaries.verdict: The best condenser mic package for the least amount of money.
pros: Four pick-up settings enhance control and artistic freedom
cons: Some controls look "flimsy," although they hold up well

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Terrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: 1 star. The product itself is fantastic but be prepared for disappointment the moment something goes wrong with it. My Blue Yeti Blackout edition started adding static to everything. It took three weeks to get an RMA and after I sent it back I was told a replacement would be out 1-2 business days from arriving. Here we are 6 weeks later and no microphone, no response from Blue customer support, not update on my RMA, nothing. Avoid. We have to hold companies like this to higher standards. Just because you make a good and affordable product doesn't mean you can have customer service this bad and stay ahead. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Saenz

customer_reviews.title: An incredible microphone packed full of features - for an amazing price [VIDEO]
customer_reviews.text: Here is my full video review of the Blue Yeti microphone that I made for my YouTube channel. In this video I cover the build and sound quality of this great microphone. Thanks for watching and enjoy! WhatLukeSays
customer_reviews.author: Luke Gall

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: DOA. Did not work when plugged into computer with the supplied usb cord. I figured it might be a cord or usb port issue, so I tried connecting it with 3 other usb cables to 5 different ports and it did not work with any combination. This proved to me that I was sent a faulty microphone, which is upsetting for such a highly rated product. Also, the usb port on the microphone itself feels very loose and my cords would often fall out if I simply moved the microphone a few inches. My snowball has been great so I was looking forward to this upgrade, but I ended up very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Brannon

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mic! For $100, the quality is astounding. I have used this for recording vocals, guitar, and cello. I have used the bi-directional mic to record stereo nature sounds of crickets, rain, thunder, creeks, and birds. When I put the headphones on to listen, it sounds like I just stepped outside. It's clear and crisp and picks up astonishing detail. This mic will pick up a whisper from 2ft. away (looking at you ASMR folks). I can go from singing soft to belting without having the sound blowout. If you are looking to move up to a nicer mic and have $100 to spend, buy this before you spend $500. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Hollis

customer_reviews.title: not worth the $$$ for podcast
customer_reviews.text: Well built product using metal throughout. The knobs are cheap and very small. And on the darker blue version, they didn’t bother to lighten the text on the item indication suctions of the knobs. Result... I recorded my old microphone next to this and played them back and my $20 dollar mic sounds exactly the same. So I figured they got me for a fancy body and style when the guts of the item don’t differ from the inexpensive ones I’ve used in the past. Money down the drain for I was looking for improvements to sound quality and that was not achieved using this mic.
customer_reviews.author: Theone

customer_reviews.title: Obvioulsy used --I sent back
customer_reviews.text: Got the product. It was obviously used and being sold again. The finish was tarnished and a sticker was mostly off. The packing was such that it was obvious tat it was someone else's return. I then sent back and got a replacement and it was the same thing. Obviously used. I ended up returning and buying directly form Yenti. The one direct from Yenti had no imperfections and you can tell from the packaging and taping it was brand new and not previously sold and returned and resold.
customer_reviews.author: Les Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Problem solver
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver for teaching online, and for making recordings online. This is a relatively inexpensive mic, and it allows me to plug in directly to my MacBook Pro USB port and also to plug my headphones into the mic, so I can hear myself clearly as well as anyone I'm talking with on Zoom or whatever. Far, far better than the laptop mic! It's been good for making music recordings and editing audio files. Best money I have spent yet since the beginning of the pandemic, since I have a feeling I'll be teaching online for awhile yet...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer in Raleigh, NC

customer_reviews.title: Supurb!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a mic. I've been recording on a cheaper Nemar Mic and thought it sounded okay, or at least good enough. I wasn't sure about upgrading to an actual mic because I'm so new to recording audios and wasn't sure it was worth the investment. Boy was I wrong. The clarity in the recording is just unbelievable. The problems I have with my voice, such as it sounding tinny and even dull, have been eliminated with this microphone. I actually sound 100% better and editing has become unnecessary. using Virtual Cable plugin to adjust sound makes this feel like a real radio mic. So pleased with this gem .
customer_reviews.author: Scott O.

customer_reviews.title: Very good. If you're doing screencasts
customer_reviews.text: Very good. If you're doing screencasts, etc, always use a mic with USB input (Like this one). I learned the hard-way, that traditional condenser mics require a really good sound card to produce good quality. The "Line-in" mic jack in the back of your computer just won't cut it! Cons: -Picks up a some background noise that is probably because of my room. (Sound proof your recording area!) I fixed this easily with some free software. (OBS -noise suppresson function) -Monitor volume knob seems cheap, although all other input buttons seem very high quality. -probably need a pop filter...I used OBS noise gate function, but it cuts out certain parts of my voice at times.
customer_reviews.author: NickoliBarrucullas

customer_reviews.title: Unusable. Terrible product support.
customer_reviews.text: When I got this, I used it primarily for Zoom and MS Teams calls. It initially worked pretty well. In the past few weeks I've tried to use it to record audio and it just has a this horrible, high-pitched whining noise that lingers in the background of every recording. I've tried changing the cable, unplugging all other USB devices, etc. but nothing has helped. I've emailed the Logitech support folks (the website is a nightmare) and they have not helped in any way. If I'd have known this would have been my experience, I would have probably just spent slightly more for a Rode or Audio Technica mic. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: shie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome usb microphone
customer_reviews.text: I have used this usb mic on my laptop for a couple of years now for 1,000 hours/year of live, interactive a) 1:1 coaching for healthcare professionals, executives, and college and university students, and b) workshops. This mic is perfect. Perfect. Easy to use, adjust. Doesn’t take up much room. Sturdy. Works well with my Rode PSA1 mic boom arm, Audioengine A2 Plus desktop speakers , and HP laptops. All can hear me well and clearly. And, the sound system of the people I interact with varies greatly from very poor to high-end systems on laptops to 100-person classrooms and small meeting rooms. I highly recommend this mic if its specs meet your needs.
customer_reviews.author: JJB

customer_reviews.title: Used too work perfectly with my MacBook and iPhone, now works with neither.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand new blue yeti mic set up Jan 2019. It worked mostly pretty great until May of 2019. The mic began to produce horrible static sound. I have changed the cord several times and bought external usb drives to help with no success. Originally it worked perfectly with my MacBook and iPhone, now works with neither. I liked the mic the first few months, I recommended it and almost bought another one. I am passed the warranty date so I'm in the position where I spent over $150 on audio equipment - that is now almost useless. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Elias

customer_reviews.title: Great Audio
customer_reviews.text: The ability to plug the headset in for your own feedback is great. Onboard gain and volume controls are also a plus. Weird that the main on/off button is solid red when on and flashing re when standby, but that's a quibble. The audio output is awesome compared to that of a laptop or webcam compared to all the others I've heard during the "Pandemic-forced meetings". It's also nice to have the various modes so if it's just me, it only picks up me (what's in front of it) vs ambient or interview modes which turn on more mics from other directions. Probably didn't need the mic cover, but it did reduce the pops (probably could have just backed up)
customer_reviews.author: Wood_fly

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Cortina and voice recording apps...
customer_reviews.text: Have yet to get this mic to work properly with my browsers, unless I’m missing some configuration settings I’m now aware of. Will not work with Google Search or Microsoft Edge for me. I’m running Windows 10 Pro which I keep updated DAILY. Also this mic is lacking an option to use a button to activate the mic, if so desired. It’s either on or off. Off means disconnection on the USB cable. No switch that I can find. Angle adjustment screw system is inferior and makes holding the mic stationary in your desired position difficult, if not impossible. The plastic clamping system seems cheap and I’m afraid to over-tighten it for fear of breaking it. Personally, not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Easy, and really nice quality.
customer_reviews.text: This really is a great mic for around $125. I have another mic of about the same price and it has great response, as well, so maybe when you get over $100 things are expected to be semi-professional. But this is sturdy and with clean, accurate sound. Looks good, too...not cheapie at all. Glad to have it. I use my other mic, too (a Beyerdynamic that needs a stand or a hand to hold it), but this sits on the table ready to go all the time. Sweet.
customer_reviews.author: W. Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Good at capturing room sound
customer_reviews.text: I am using the Mevo Plus and Mevo Boost to stream church services, I needed a USB microphone to plug into the Mevoas the Mevo microphone is kind of weak with less-than-stellar sound quality. To be honest, I was a little worried that a microphone meant for podcasts would work. However, once we got the gain set properly, it works great. I am currently using the cardioid pattern exclusively. Because of the room acoustics, I still pick up crying babies and such, but at least I'm only capturing reflected sound. I am very happy with the microphone and would recommend it for use with the Mevo.
customer_reviews.author: Kristofer Carlson

customer_reviews.title: It broke. after short period of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microphone for two reasons, for my wife to use recording classroom lectures, and for me to digitally tune my boat stereo speakers with a digital signal processor. After only a few uses, I noticed the USB mini port was loose. After another use or two, it stopped powering on. I bought two new cords and tried them...nothing. What a waste. It is a good looking microphone. I thought it looked cool and seemed well made. But the cheap port in the bottom WILL fail you. Its only a matter of time...(and not a long time at that). Steer clear of this product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tenison

customer_reviews.title: Crystal clear
customer_reviews.text: Having worked from home for 3 months now (due to the pandemic), I got frustrated with the poor quality of my laptop computer mic (people are always saying they cannot hear me, or I am breaking up), and I wanted an alternative from using my cell phone. I finally settled on getting an external USB mic. This one had several positive reviews, so I decided to get the Yeti Blue. It arrived quicker than the original projected delivery date. I immediately plugged in into my computer for my next call. It worked great! Easy to use, clear sound. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time... just get it!!!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about this product... well, very GOOD!!! GOOD sound quality, GOOD all around features, GOOD for gaming, streaming, hosting, speaking, teaching. Buy the best you get the best. Price worth the product quality, performance, built, and look. I thought I'll go cheap and be happy, big disappointment, now I actually spend more.
customer_reviews.author: PinoyGwapo

customer_reviews.title: Microphone for music recording and Skype lessons
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this microphone to put very close to my piano so that, during my Skype lessons with my teacher who lives in another city, the quality of the sound would be better than that of just the computer microphone. She said the sound quality was much better on her end. Also, the recordings I’ve done of my students playing piano or singing are of higher quality. This kicks it up a notch! I read a lot of other reviews to decide on how much money I needed to spend to achieve my objectives and am glad I went with this, as a lot of other less expensive choices seemed to emphasize spoken voice recording.
customer_reviews.author: Always shopping Amazon

customer_reviews.title: No luck with this design -- annoying!
customer_reviews.text: This was my most disappointing purchase this year. All the buttons are misplaced. I fiddled with them all and could never get a good sound. A waste of my time -- gain, volume, knobs for range, useless. Even the darn cord is misplaced; it blocks the mic's mobility. This gets my lowest rating. All the knobs need a redesign. This warps my voice and accents the wrong things. My $30 black mic, Amazon special, with one knob, volume only, delivers better results. This is clunky crap. I'll give it away to or throw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter Haven

customer_reviews.title: A million settings, but none work well.
customer_reviews.text: Do you want a microphone that will pick up every hum and click, and even the next door neighbors, no matter how you configure it? If so, this is your mic! I have a rule about tech—if you have to play with it for hours to get it right, it’s not a consumer product and shouldn’t be sold to consumers. I’ve tried every possible thing to get this microphone to focus on my voice and not everything else and it just doesn’t work. Great spy microphone, I guess. TERRIBLE podcast mic.
customer_reviews.author: C. William Sandberg

customer_reviews.title: perfect microphone for voice, Skype, gaming
customer_reviews.text: I researched a bit before landing on the Blue Yeti. I am very pleased with this microphone. Like most people, I find myself suddenly needing a home office. I grew very tired of earbuds with an in-line mic. This mic is perfect for Skype Meetings and voice recordings. It’s USB connection seems like the way to go for this type microphone. I can be right on the mic, or standing back a few feet, without worry about folks not hearing me. Easy to setup, easy to operate! 👍🏼🤷🏻‍♂️
customer_reviews.author: David Harry

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love this! I got another USB microphone when I first started my YouTube channel because I was just starting out. Despite the very affordable price with a pop filter, that microphone resulted in a lot of static and other undesirable sounds. I saw Dom's Comics was using a Blue Yeti from one of his vids and I saw the other rave reviews on Amazon. I decided to get one and I am really glad I did. The sound is amazing in comparison to the USB mic I was using before.I also added the Foam Windscreen for Blue Yeti (VocalBeat) to further filter out extraneous sounds. So far, I am very happy with this mic.
customer_reviews.author: Syn

customer_reviews.title: Lot's of noise pick-up. Decent mic though.
customer_reviews.text: While a lot of people give rave reviews for this mic and even show in videos how it compares to other mics - supposedly without editing -I have yet to have the same experience. The sound pick-up is great, but it picks up too much. Apparently, the only way to fix it is to set up a full-on sound studio with sound absorbent paneling. That said, it's been an instrumental piece of equipment to me as I have been making videos for my students due to the Teleschool situation during the Covid-19 outbreak and safety measures.
customer_reviews.author: YouYourself&Yourself

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thing 4 years ago so I wouldn't have to use the shoddy mic on my headphones. Overall the quality of this microphone is top notch, I love all the adjustable settings and it certainly picks up sound in multiple directions. I haven't yet needed to buy a pop filter for it, but maybe that's because I'm not really projecting my voice into it like someone who's using it for video-making or singing would. I would buy this again if I ever needed to replace mine!
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the plug an play experience, solid mic so far.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the same reason you're probably thinking about it. To flex on all of your coworkers and family during zoom meetings. For that purpose its great. I actually can sit 6ft from my set up and comfortably talk from my couch with family and come through amazing. My only issue with this mic was that on initial set up my PC detects it as a "speaker" which effectively mutes my computer. I had to get creative with some software I use to stream in order to fix that problem. YMMV, having multiple inputs and outputs might have been the issue anyway?
customer_reviews.author: robb Poier

customer_reviews.title: High-Pitched Buzz - Unusable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a couple of years ago, but used it only a couple of times. Took it out again a couple of months ago to use it for Zoom meetings. Worked fine a couple of times, then started emitting a high-pitched buzzing noise. Not just on Zoom, but anywhere I use it. I've researched, and it looks like a LOT of people have had this happen with these mics, and there doesn't seem to be any explanation, or any suggestion as to fix it. It's rendered the unit completely unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: WORKS PERFECT WITH LINUX MINT 19.1
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy how well the Blue Yeti Silver Edition Mic works with LINUX MINT 19.1. Simply plug into the USB and it was immediately available. Just click on the speaker Icon in the bottom tray, then select Sound Setting. You will see you can select it for Microphone and or Speaker Output. Quality is EXCELLENT. I use it with Audacity. Keep your GAIN way down, it's very powerful. I am using this with a newer Acer 575g laptop running LINUX MINT 19.1. This is an excellent combination for your recording needs, and far superior to WinBlows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Micster

customer_reviews.title: The oversized hole issues has been fixed, works with Radius II and Rode PSA1 Boom
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this will mount to the Radius II Shock mount and Rode PSA1 Boom. If you're worried like I was that this won't mount because of the hole being too big, the problem has been fixed. I received this, the Radius II, and the Rode PSA1 boom on 14 Feb 2018 and it all went together seamlessly. I almost didn't purchase this because of the reported problems and video's proving the struggle was real. Hope this helps, anybody reluctant to pull the trigger like I was. Great mic, works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: Almost, but not completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased April 2018 Received the mic without the cord. Notified the seller but nothing happened. No big deal, I have lots of cords, but it should have came with one, and the seller should have shipped one. My only real concern with this mic is the mute switch. It works sometimes. Poor quality in the mute switch. Design feature is the LED light that constantly blinks when muted. You can't turn it off without unplugging. Kind of annoying. Great mic otherwise. Today is April 2020 The mute button has become a real Pain in the A$$. There are many other mics out there. I would pass over this one. I'm shopping for a new mic...anybody want a cheap Blue?
customer_reviews.author: ImpHalla

customer_reviews.title: The bane of my existence.
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing. The power connector became loose immediately so if the cable moves at all it disconnects itself from my computer. After a year the headphone jack became loose and the wire for the headphone has to be held precariously still. And before either of those bits of planned obsolence, it was useless to use for playing a game over the Internet. There was a two second delay before it started pushing any sound out (on multiple programs/platform/systems). I hate the Blue Yeti, I wish I never bought it and I hope you read this and start to hate it too.
customer_reviews.author: Ice Cream Jonsey

customer_reviews.title: Great mic, shame about the stand
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these for conference calls at work. The sound quality is excellent, so they do what they are supposed to. The mute button is a little confusing. We use Google meet and sometimes the button mutes, other times it doesn't, and the mute symbol never comes up on the screen so we just stopped trying. Not a big deal really. The reson I knocked a star off, is that within a few weeks my stand was broken. One of the screws just turns and turns. I put the mic on an old stand I had laying around but it was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Polk

customer_reviews.title: Great mic, great sound
customer_reviews.text: My job requires me to record voice audio to accompany slides and video training material, and I have struggled FOR YEARS with the audio quality of my recordings, usually in Camtasia. Since I picked up this mic, I have had ZERO issues with the sound. Great microphone, just wish I had bought it a year before I actually did. It would have saved me countless hours of frustration and slipped project deadlines.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Mcmahon

customer_reviews.title: Your voice too can be deep and full of it
customer_reviews.text: Dear Fellow Folks who want to sound good. This is a good Microphone. It makes even the most ho-hum of us sound like Barry White -- that is if we have the deepness of vocal cords. Ladies will sound better. Yet, this Microphone is just for use for your Podcasting creation. Read, sing, be it all. It does not include Midi, that's a different more expensive model. However, most will be happy with this as long as it is purchased when on Sale. Works well on GNU/Linux (Pop!_OS) and Mac. It is Audacity capable on Linux. QuickTime works fine on the Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Microphone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this microphone to help make tutorial videos and the voice quality is incredible. Although it is slightly pricey, it is well worth the investment. Very minimal post production to get rid of any unwanted background noise and it is incredibly simple to use. My only complaints about the microphone are that it is quite heavy and the gain can be set too sensitive too easily so keep it very low for best audio quality, especially if recording from a close proximity.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this microphone!
customer_reviews.text: This is literally the most frustrating piece of "technology" I've ever had the misfortune of dealing with. When it does work, the quality is mediocre at best. When it doesn't, it suffers from high-pitch whine, muffled sound, requiring uninstalls of drivers, rebooting of software, rebooting of operating system. Every day is an adventure trying to get the Blue Yeti to work! It's still under warranty, yes, but warranty doesn't cover shipping, so I'd be throwing good money after bad trying to get this expensive pile of garbage to perform as a microphone. Please, please, believe me and choose any other microphone other than this one! Save yourself the headaches!
customer_reviews.author: Autorock

customer_reviews.title: Wellll...
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality really is good. But it does pick up a good amount af background noise so u cant take any short cuts with getting foam etc. I love the settings on the mic .. U can really hear the difference ... Its easy to hook up to an ipad also.
customer_reviews.author: Rrenasb

customer_reviews.title: Big fan of these mics
customer_reviews.text: My son uses it for gaming -- I think that's overkill but he has no issues with it. I use mine for conference calls & recording training videos. Couldn't be happier. It works well in all cases. Better than all the budget mics you'll find on Amazon. Best part is, in the right mode, you can set up the mic about 10-14 inches away (ie: out of camera shot) and still get good quality sound. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: vardelda

customer_reviews.title: As much as I love the Blue Yeti Mics They Scare Me.
customer_reviews.text: I really have to say that Blue Yeti Mics were my favorite.i really like the looks the weight and the sound. The stand is unique and awesome.And this midnight blue color is sharp...But Blue Yeti Mics scare me due to the defective mini USB ports in the mics. And when they go unless it's under warranty you can't find anyone to repair them unless you want to try and attempt to do the repair yourself you'll have to be a master solderer...I had two with these defective ports and couldn't get them repaired...It's a shame cause as I stated I really like these mics but they scare me enough now to stay away from them...Gary
customer_reviews.author: Gary Bilczo

customer_reviews.title: Great Mic, Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This mic definitely improved the sound quality for my videos. The only reason it doesn't get five stars is that there were no instruction on how to attach the pop filter. I found a link to some instructions on the Blue website, but it was dead, returning a 404 error. I emailed the company and informed them of the dead link, but when they emailed back, they provided only the same dead link. They lose a star for poor customer service. I eventually figured it out, but it does come loose nearly every time I adjust the position of the filter. Otherwise I am quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great mic.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Is this the greatest USB microphone available on the market? Honestly, no. HOWEVER it is just about perfect for anyone needing a good, not-quite-professional-but-Im-no-filthy-casual microphone. While there are slightly better sounding mics, the cost difference is pretty ridiculous, making this a wonderful bang for your buck microphone. If you're looking for something a lot better and more professional, then you're looking for an XLR setup, with an amp and everything.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Very good mic . Compatible with a variety of programs . Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This mic was purchased as a gift for my son. He has been waxing ecstatic about it since he opened it and set it up. There are a lot of technical terms he's been using. Settings, lots and lots of settings. How much it can register. VERY sturdy, of which I can attest. Easy to set up. Compatible with several programs. He went on and on. To say the least it seems to be exactly what he wanted and needed. Crisp sound. He was recording himself while playing a game and told me it was perfect. Also played guitar a little and the mic performed very well.
customer_reviews.author: Monique J.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Very Flexible
customer_reviews.text: Since I only have this one mic to use for multiple situations, it's really helpful to have the switch between patterns and the separate gain knob. It seems to interface quickly with the computer when plugged in, and my audio workstation software works with it seamlessly. It's also build like a tank, with quality metal that won't scratch easily. There's literally nothing to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Bassett

customer_reviews.title: Best mic for everything
customer_reviews.text: I thought this product was amazing. Definitely an investment. The only concern was that other microphones had different prices for their color. I feel as if they should all have the same price. But overall this is perfect for everything, it's easy to set up, easy to use, easy to put away. It is the most convient and effective microphone out there. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DIbrahim

customer_reviews.title: Great Functionality, Not Great Cosmetic Issues
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality and features are great. What I don't like. If you remove the microphone from the base and then try to put it back on, it is very difficult. It is almost impossible not to scratch the microphone up while doing so. The smallest pressure and it leaves a scratch. Also noticed area on the microphone top where the black paint was missing. All of this is cosmetic and not a huge deal, but am dropping two stars. From a functionality and ease of use point of view; this is a great product. Someone just needs to improve the finishing/painting quality (black model).
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: This microphone was great for the first 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This microphone was great for the first 3 months. However, now I'm having some serious gain issues. I'm pretty sure it's a problem with the input not power the mic properly. However, I have changed cords and used different computers. If I wiggle the cord it will work..sometimes. The microphone will randomly start picking up EVERYTHING with the gain all the way down, and it begins distorting my voice. Moving the cord around slightly will sometimes fix the problem. Either way, unless this is a lemon.. I would NOT recommend this microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Cohen

customer_reviews.title: DROP THE MIC!!! 👍🏽
customer_reviews.text: The Blue Yeti microphone gives you professional sound quality. I've had this mic since 2016 it is still one of the best microphones in the market. Whether you need it for podcasting, voice-over, or any other sound required project, this microphone will improve your results considerably. Great sound quality, easy to use, and perfect value for money. Perhaps the most outstanding thing about this microphone is the pattern settings, so you can choose the one that best suits your project. That makes it a very versatile microphone! Overall, the Blue Yeti is just great.
customer_reviews.author: Giuneur B. Mosi

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent microphone and I am super satisfied with it
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent microphone and I am super satisfied with it, however, the problem with the Blue Yeti is that it captures way too much background noise, including keyboard typing! In order to prevent the background noise from being captured, I had to buy a shock mount along with a stand for the Blue Yeti, my problems were gone after that. I would have rated this microphone a 5/5 if it were not for the complications with background noise being captured. In conclusion, great microphone, amazing features: mute button, a headphone jack to hear sound input being captured, and different ways sounds are captured (omnidirectional, stereo, etc.), sound quality is also great.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: It just works.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. No problem switching from the standard base to a mounting arm. Works like a charm. Having used it in both the cardioid and bidirectional modes, I've gotten very good results. The only adjustment that needs to be made is the gain, which is easy. For videoconferencing, it might be a bit more than you need because sometimes the limited quality of other participants' computer audio equipment often influences the quality of the sound they hear. For podcasts and other recording applications, its excellent. Use it in a room that has good audio properties and you will sound great.
customer_reviews.author: Chestnut

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay...
customer_reviews.text: Very sensitive mic, have a program to tweak audio or go with a better quality microphone
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Last
customer_reviews.text: For a while after I bought this mic all seemed ok, the voice quality was good and it did an ok job dealing with background noise. But one day the driver just stopped functioning completely and I had to get it replaced. I received a replacement from Blue however now I'm experiencing consistent issues with the mic making a lot of static and capping, no matter how I tweak the settings both software and on the yeti. For its cost and considering it moves all of a handful of times a year, you'd hope this mic wouldn't be so prone to having what seems like hardware issues each time
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: I bought this microphone from the seller, 1. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this microphone from the seller, 1.5 months it was not used because there was no equipment / stand for the microphone. After installing everything, I worked for exactly a week, after that the sound disappeared, there was electronic noise - the microphone is not working, the warranty is no longer there. Купил данный микрофон у продавца, 1,5 месяца он не использовался из за того что не было оборудования/стойки для микрофона. После установки всего, проработал ровно неделю, после этого звук исчез, остался электронный шум - микрофон не исправен, гарантии уже нет.
customer_reviews.author: Wartor

customer_reviews.title: Clear and powerful mic that eliminated the "air noise".
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing mic. First, I ordered a condenser mic off of Wish. I had accessories to eliminate noise. Didn't work. It had that aux tv air sound in the back. I tried using a cheap headset I had. While it eliminated that air sound, it had an echo. The Yeti couldn't get to me fast enough, especially since I ordered on a late Thursday. It doesn't have that air sound streaming behind your voice. It is as clear as untouched spring water. It is powerful enough to capture outside traffic if you don't record in a back room or have studio foam set up. I am going to buy a few more for backups.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Connell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality! Perfect for Podcasts
customer_reviews.text: I shopped around and found this to be one of the better mics for podcasts and it was for sure correct! The sound on playback is clear, doesn’t pickup too much background when the gain is down and works very well. I love how easy it works with headphones, setup is simple, and how the gain is adjustable. Great buy worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Max Fountain

customer_reviews.title: Weak MicroUSB Port Prone to Failure
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for two years. I rate it highly on sound quality. However there is one fatal flaw with this product that has rendered it inoperable. The microUSB port is rather weak and broke. There are many YouTube videos out there documenting this weakness and failure. Some even show how to fix it yourself. I have contacted BLUE Yeti over this shortcoming, and I'll let you know what they say about repair. I am hesitant to buy another Yeti and experience the same result
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Edgerly

customer_reviews.title: Best Mic I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of experience with mics. I generally use a mid-level gaming headset for gaming (Logitech G930 or Corsair void pro). They have a pretty decent mic but when I had to do presentations for school, they sounded tinny and popped a lot. The school app didn't have as good of filters as skype I'm assuming. If you watch any semi-professional to professional youtube personalities, this mic is easily equivalent (to my untrained ears). I do not use it when gaming or skyping. It's kind of bulky and cumbersome. But, as some reviewers have said and I agree, it's an approximate $100 mic that sounds like the $1000 mics.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Picks up a lot of background noise
customer_reviews.text: So I have the Yeti and the Snowball and while the yeti is definitely more functional its picks up a lot more like 100% more background noise than the snowball. You can kinda reduce background noise by changing the sound profile on the back of the mic but it's still noticeable. The main reason I Iike the yeti more than the snowball is the USB cord that doesn't constantly run the risk of falling out like the snowball.
customer_reviews.author: Rex T. Paradox

customer_reviews.title: The USB port is extremely fragile
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and search the internet on the blue microphone microUSB ports. Many users report them breaking after only one use. Mine lasted 3-4 uses before it broke. Now I am in contact with customer service trying to sort it out. The mic stand is built in a way such that a lot of pressure gets put on a really cheap microUSB port. Once the micro-port is broken, the microphone is unusable. I am surprised that they have not updated this issue because the microphone itself is quite robust.
customer_reviews.author: dqbirdie

customer_reviews.title: Very good podcast mic
customer_reviews.text: At this price this mic gives you excellent quality. It may not be top of the line, but it gets the job done at good quality. You may need something to soundproof your room like soundproof curtains or foam pads on your walls because this thing picks up such good audio I could hear conversations from the apartments in the buildings next door to us about 25 feet away!!!
customer_reviews.author: william d.

customer_reviews.title: Ya get what ya pay for
customer_reviews.text: I am a voice actor, I needed a class A mic set up. I tried others, but was given Yeti as a "tip" from another voice actor. Whatever you may need this for, it is worth the money, easy to set up, works great with my Bowers & Wilkens headphones . I also have an attachable voice filter. Look no further , this is a class act.
customer_reviews.author: Rit Walker

customer_reviews.title: Very sensitive.
customer_reviews.text: This mic is fantastic. The quality is amazing and everyone that hears me talk over it completely agrees! They also agree that everything in the room with me also sounds loud and crystal clear as if it were right next to the mic regardless of location in relation to the mic. The gain switch doesn’t work and I’m not too sure if the direction settings work either. There is no noticeable change when I switch it from front facing to surround sound or two way. It picks up everyone loud and clear. So, if you live alone without pets in a soundproof room then I recommend this mic, just don’t breathe too hard.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound, cheaper quality.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - It has four different audio settings, gain adjustment, volume adjustment, and a mute button. - Easy to use with almost any mic stand. - Sound quality is amazing. - Can be used for ASMR. - Looks nice. Cons: - cheap USB port/ cheap USB cord. Haven’t had this long and my usb cord already broke. The header broke off INTO my mic randomly. I never move it around or unplug it so there was no reason for this to happen. - heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah K Ritter

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mic over 2 and a half years ago and it finally broke.. I dont know what happened, I just started sounding like a robot through it.. Anyway I emailed customer service and told them the situation and that the warranty had expired. I got an email back saying to send it in for testing, which I promptly did. Today I received a brand new Mic in the mail!!! Thats awesome.. even after I told them that the warranty was expired!!! Yer my boy Blue!!
customer_reviews.author: Hawaiian PorchMonkey

customer_reviews.title: It may fall apart the day after you warranty expires.
customer_reviews.text: It's lucky I gave it 3 stars. I've had this mic for just over 2 years. It has a 2 year manufacturer's warranty. After 2 years and 1 month, it stops detecting as a Blue Yeti on any computer and shows up as "USB Advanced Audio." People on the other end can still hear me and it will still record, but I can't hear myself through headphones connected to the mic anymore. I did some research and found out that this is a common problem with both the Yeti and the Snowball. Also, the quality when recording now that it doesn't show up as a Blue Yeti is no better than the cheapest mics out there.
customer_reviews.author: PTF

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a Professional youtuber
customer_reviews.text: The microphone was awesome and background noise is greatly reduced once you watch your recorded output on you tube using this microphone. I had bought this twice for my husband and for my son who were both using them to broadcast on their you tube channel (self-help video instructions on my husband's part) and for games and chat channels or recording game instructions on his server (my son); both of them agreed that their microphone were all worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: amazona

customer_reviews.title: Great microphone when it works
customer_reviews.text: A great professional microphone while it's working. I bought two in December 2017. The first one stopped working in October 2018. They replaced it. The second one stopped working in April 2019. They let me get a return authorization online, which was easy. These break too easily and way too soon. I bought third one to serve as a backup in case one goes down. Still a good mic with quality pickup. When using the desktop stand that's provided, it picks up every bump, thump, keystroke and soft slide across the desk. Once I mounted it on an arm with a shock mount, it's a great piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Aune

customer_reviews.title: Not good for long-term investment
customer_reviews.text: It was a decent sounding microphone while it lasted. But I cannot recommend it for any voice actors, beginning or otherwise. And that's because it simply stopped working after a year and a half. If you're considering dipping your toe into voice acting, you may have heard that this is a good microphone for testing the waters. It. Is. Not. Put your money towards something else.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Costumer support is worthless
customer_reviews.text: Just a week after the return window the miniUSB connector in the base of the microphone has come loose, making it very difficult to maintain a good electrical connection. Mic was used in its supplied stand. I contacted the customer support and they did not even address the problem and did not offer any solutions or replacement in the response.
customer_reviews.author: cristina smith

customer_reviews.title: S W E E T !
customer_reviews.text: This microphone far surpasses every expectation. The sound capture is amazing, the controls are well placed, and jacks are convenient and secure, and the stand/base is designed well. Of note, when this mic and stand are on a table top, every vibration is transmitted through the base--key clicks, mouse clicks, laptop fan, monitor fan, etc., so use a base isolation tray such as a square candy dish with wide rubber bands (see YouTube videos.) It will pick up outdoor noise from A/C compressors and lawn mowers a block away, so use a good mic shield or sound box.
customer_reviews.author: WizGeek; ArtfulCutie

customer_reviews.title: I love this microphone!
customer_reviews.text: This microphone is awesome. I stream games and love it! The onboard gain setting is great for controlling background noise bleed through. The onboard mute switch and volume knob are nice to have too. The quality is a very noticeable step up from my previous microphone and I haven't had any echo/distortion issues with it yet. It is very easy to set up, and I love that you can customize it for where you are positioned around the mic to get the best sound possible.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: You can't get a better, more stylish microphone for the price
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Just Wow! Have been eyeing this Yeti USB Microphone for months. I finally made the purchase, and I couldn't be happier. Absolutely gorgeous microphone with solid construction. Has a nice, hefty weight to it. Plugged it into my powered USB hub on my iMac. It would not initially work, that is, until I unplugged some USB devices from the hub. Seems like the Yeti needs an ample amount of power to operate. So, certainly you could plug it directly to the back of your computer -- but if you use a hub, it may not operate if there are other connections present. Sound quality is amazingly good with an absence of additional noise. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald EpsteinTop Contributor: Amazon Echo

customer_reviews.title: RMA'd it, confirmed dead, received replacement
customer_reviews.text: Add my Blue Yeti to the growing list of dead mics after a short use. Confirmed it was dead with swapping out the cable, then trying on two different PCs. One PC which has a working Blue Yeti (tested). Using that known good cable the Yeti still would not work. Updated review; sent the microphone in for repair. Confirmed dead by techs, they sent a new one out. Probably all within 7 business days. 5 Stars for customer support and their quick response, one star reduction for original mic dying in such a short time frame.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Right out of the box-- Mute button does not work
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product yesterday, and received it today-- I was very excited. The sound seems good, though I'll need more time to really know how it does. However, right out of the box, the mute button does not work. At all. I don't really need a mute button for my purposes, BUT someone out there might. And the product is brand new, so the button really should work fresh out of the box. I'm concerned that that doesn't bode well for the life of the microphone, but I'm going to give it a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Possibly used
customer_reviews.text: So i bought mine new and when i received it there was 3 small chipped paint spots on the top of the mic, on top of that it was pretty dusty as if it was out for awhile.. and in further inspection there was small white spots as if was maybe mold or something within the sides of the blue yeti. Other than that it works fine, has good quality, and havent ran into to issues yet. Did i get a used Blue Yeti or maybe refurbished? Im debating on wanting a exchange because the small paint damage and it possibly being refurbished?
customer_reviews.author: Chris F.

customer_reviews.title: Great microphone for any voice overlay.
customer_reviews.text: This microphone is VERY sensitive to sound. It will pick up your dog barking in the other room. If you're using a third party software like OBS or Audacity, then I would strongly suggest using a filter to take out any background noise and apply a Noise Gate and possibly a Compressor to the mic.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor S.

customer_reviews.title: The Blue Yeti is simply amazing. This review will be based around a Podcaster ...
customer_reviews.text: The Blue Yeti is simply amazing. This review will be based around a Podcaster / Streamer user. For the best mic set up you will need: - mic set to cardiod - dragonpad pop filter - a desk mounted boom arm (The Image® Broadcasting Studio Microphone Arm Stand with Shock Mount, is perfect for the budget restricted i have bought, and reviewd that item aswell, so read that too!) For the best mic sound (to get the amazing crisp sound all the top streamers have) you need to watch the included video. needed downloads are below! (all links are safe and virus free also free to use/donation-ware) Use this video to make your mic sound amazing! [...]
customer_reviews.author: Austin H.

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing mic, you can't exactly go wrong with this mic as it's so clear. It's generally not for those who cannot afford expansions like a boom arm or a pop filter but regardless it's just as find on it's own sitting on it's little stand. If you really can't afford this big boy, just get the Blue Snowball, it's a weird one but if price is your concern then this is the next best thing.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control and already used and damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered damaged even though the box was fine. Black smudge marks that don’t come off, scratches in the metal everywhere, and the top of the mic is dented. No instructions. USB cord did not have a tie. Obviously pre-used.
customer_reviews.author: jdmart

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loved this Blue Yeti!
customer_reviews.text: She plans on using it for YouTube, Instagram, etc. It was a lot larger than we expected, and you do have to have another device if you are using this with an iPad. It's more made for a laptop computer with how it hooks up to the computer. However, we did get the right piece to connect it to her iPad and she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Great For YouTube, Twitch and Podcasts
customer_reviews.text: There is a reason that Blue is so popular among content creators, they just work. The Blue Yeti provides amazing quality with a simple USB plug-n-play setup. I have used this microphone with Audacity, Shotcut, Davinci Resolve, and even as my in-game chat microphone while playing online games and I have absolutely zero complaints. If you are a content creator or you run your own podcast, and you are looking for a quality microphone that is easy to use and doesn't cost an arm and a leg, I would definitely recommend getting a Blue Yeti.
customer_reviews.author: Haggard Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I got the Blackout edition Blue Yeti mic and really wish it worked because it looks great. It worked for a few minutes then next thing i know i'm spending upwards of 8+ hours on youtube and google searching for ways to fix it. From testing in Discord mic test where you can hear your mic's feedback, nothing was coming though after all these hours of troubleshooting besides one thing, which is when i tap on the mic. Even when i do that i can only hear the tapping very faintly. Don't know what to do at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley L Davis

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this product for ASMR channel and it works fine, but I didn't give it 5 stars because theres very little information on how to use this microphone effectively. I have a MacBook Air and I'm not sure if I can use it and my blue yeti together to make videos if that makes sense. I have searched everywhere and have literally came up with nothing. I see people using the blue yeti in their videos all the time but I can't seem to figure this out. If anyone knows anything please let me know, would be much appreciated.:)
customer_reviews.author: kesh

customer_reviews.title: Great multipurpose microphone.
customer_reviews.text: I love how this microphone has different pickup patterns! I can switch on the fly to suit my recording needs, be it for solo recordings or when I'm recording a conversation with others. The weighted stand is nice, but I personally like to keep it on a little swing arm for more freedom. Being able to hear myself as I'm recording with like zero latency is a nice plus. Honestly this is one of the best USB mics out there, especially for those of us who can't afford more professional setups.
customer_reviews.author: Real Human Person

customer_reviews.title: The right tool for a number of jobs.  Versatile and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a vast improvement over the built-in mic on my iMac. (Works with Mac or Windows.) I use it to make videos of me playing my trumpet or flugelhorn and post on my business page. It has several modes, making it very versatile. The instruction booklet is very clear if one takes the time to read and understand it. My only problem is placement to get proper balance between my horn and my speaker dock, but that is no fault of the Yeti. Simple trial and error will yield proper placement. The Yeti can be set up as mono-directional, bi-directional, or omni-directional, making it quite versatile. I am very happy with the unit. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Horny Trumpeter

customer_reviews.title: Best mic hands down they said and i approve
customer_reviews.text: Labeled as the best mic and it does live to the reputation so far it's clear with many options but you have to get it off the stand due to the fact that it can pick keyboard/mouse sounds and any vibration or hit to the table the stand is left on, i got it on Innogear mic stand and it's works of art and i might get the shock mount radius for the blue yeti + a pop filter soon.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Did you hear this was a fantastic prosumer mic?
customer_reviews.text: You heard right. It's fantastic. Honestly, don't see myself buying anything else for a while. The ONLY "problem" is that it is only USB-out. If you're buying this microphone, hopefully you already know that, but if you want a setup with a hardware mixer, this doesn't have the (XLR) output that you probably want to be using. That's not a bad thing, though, it's just a note. Great microphone!
customer_reviews.author: rockerest

customer_reviews.title: I'm In Love....
customer_reviews.text: This is a great microphone! It's very easy to setup and use, and the instructions are clear and simple. It's a bit bigger and heavier than I expected, but it's not bad. The sound that's produced is very clear and natural sounding, which I'm very happy about as previous microphones made me sound like a 12 year old boy. I'm very happy with the quality of this microphone, and I look forward to using it for my projects.
customer_reviews.author: J. Peck

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: This product is to expensive for its outdated technology. Only buy this if you're okay with tons of background noise and static. Even messing with the settings on the mic and computer settings alike, this mic will still disappoint with poor quality. I bought a mic that came with a boom stand and shock mount for $50 and it is world's better than this piece of junk. I would be willing to sell this mic for $25 just to get a small portion back of what I paid and I still feel like I would be ripping of the person who bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mic
customer_reviews.text: I was never really able to afford an actual high-quality mic in the past - stuck with headsets, while the quality was still good, weren't as good as a lot of other microphones even if the sound quality of the headphones were great. Finally getting the money, I purchased this mic because a friend of mine has one and I loved how it sounds. I do not regret buying this at all and am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Dax

customer_reviews.title: Did its job
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this forever and am just now writing a review. Did its job for the years I had it However, unless this is now an updated version, I believe it doesn't work with USB 3.0 ports. So just be careful of that if you buy this and have a motherboard with only 3.0+ ports.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this mic if you want to start a podcast or stream. The quality is very good. The quality is great out of the box but tinker with the settings in windows or whatever application you are using it on for best results. My voice is crisp and everyone compliments my mic in game.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Stigall

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 4 months of super light use
customer_reviews.text: This mic stopped working after 4 months of light use. It was decent when it worked, but that's a big price tag for a mic that has issues like turning on. I googled it and apparently, the USB plugs on these fail often. You can fix it if you know how to sauder (I do not) and take the thing apart. I do not recommend if you need a quality mic that will last you a while :(
customer_reviews.author: JRo

customer_reviews.title: Best Microphone possible for recording and gaming.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this microphone, its perfect for recording videos and sounds good and even looks good. a little heavy but that's fine. It doesn't even weigh down an arm stand. One problem when I first bought this i set it up and the mic rotated and ended up breaking the tip of the plug off so I had to find another one around my house so be careful because your cable may break to if mic is rotated to much on the stand it comes with. AMAZING MICROPHONE THOUGH.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Best microphone for creating instructional videos on Youtube.
customer_reviews.text: The voice quality is top notch. Make sure to get a pop filter or foam cover as this microphone picks up so well it will amplify your lips smacking. I'm really happy with it. If you are looking for an ASMR microphone the "Blue Yeti" is it. I use Camtasia, Filmora, Davinchi Resolve, and Adobe Premiere for voice-overs and the microphone always delivers top-notch audio.
customer_reviews.author: F. Valerio

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 uses. A common problem with these.
customer_reviews.text: Used 2 times, and the USB cable broke!!! (You can find many reports of these online.) Plugged in, it doesn't work. Used different cables and ports, does not work. Used twice for 100$. I do not recommend. Sound quality is great except a bit of white noise. Would be great if continued working.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for work, now plan to get my own
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for work, as I was tired of us using $20 logitech headsets for important communications. I wanted something high quality that wouldn't pick up the constant background chatter we always face, and this not only provides crystal clear clarity, but doesn't pick up people speaking loudly a few feet away. So impressed by it I'm planning to purchase one for my wife now.
customer_reviews.author: Tankcommander

customer_reviews.title: Quality is Great
customer_reviews.text: This is the first microphone I've ever purchased and let me say, it was worth every penny. There's just so much that I want to say. The build quality, the options you can select for the environment, and the sound quality.....just magnificent! The ONLY downfall that I see, which others may see is that it's HUGE and HEAVY. From an estimated guess, without the stand, it weighs a good 3-6 lbs. So it'll be a challenge to keep this mic straight with a mic boom. Do I recommend this product? Why yes indeed. $120 may be a lot but with the sound quality you're getting, you won't think about the money you've spent for a second.
customer_reviews.author: Zoya Love

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about three weeks and then suddenly it wouldn’t pick up sound anoymore. Checking all connections, drivers, and trying it on different computers didn’t help either. I had to get it replaced. Kind of disappointing from a 250 dollar mic.
customer_reviews.author: Blaze Dugger

customer_reviews.title: Static Will Not Go Away
customer_reviews.text: I've tried everything and I cannot eliminate the static behind my voice. No one is available to assist. Forget leaving a voicemail at the company as no one will call you back. There's no "best practices" on how to set this up. And hours of watching YouTube videos has been a waste of time. I just bought "Amazon's Choice" for $29.99 and so far it works like a charm. My guess is that this microphone is so sophisticated and is designed to be used in a professional studio.
customer_reviews.author: SD2001

product_meta.title: Blue Yeti USB Mic for Recording & Streaming on PC and Mac, 3 Condenser Capsules, 4 Pickup Patterns, Headphone Output and Volume Control, Mic Gain Control, Adjustable Stand, Plug & Play - Silver
product_meta.description: Style:Mic Only| Color:SilverYeti is the most advanced and versatile multi-pattern USB microphone available anywhere. Combining three capsules and four different pattern settings, Yeti is the ultimate tool for creating amazing recordings, directly to your computer. With a sleek Silver finish, Yeti adds style and energy to your recording or broadcasting setup. Now you can capture anything with a clarity and ease unheard of in a USB microphone. Featuring Blue's innovative triple capsule array, Yeti can record in stereo or your choice of three other unique patterns, including cardioid, omnidirectional, and bidirectional. Utilizing a high quality A-D converter, a built-in headphone amplifier for zero-latency monitoring, and direct controls for headphone volume, pattern selection, instant mute, and microphone gain. With no drivers to install, Yeti is the most versatile USB mic lighting up the airwaves today.
feature_bullets: Tri-capsule array - 3 condenser capsules can record almost any situation.
Multiple pattern selection - cardioid, bidirectional, omnidirectional & stereo.
Gain control, mute button, and zero-latency headphone output.
Perfect for vocals, musical instruments, podcasting, voiceovers, interviews, field recordings, conference calls. Signal to Noise: 100dB

Compatible with Windows 10, Windows 8 (including 8.1), Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows XP (Home and Professional), and Mac OS X (10.4.11 or higher), and requires a minimum of 64 MB of RAM(remove existing and upload).
